messages.content: I've been experiencing some physical symptoms that are really worrying me. My heart has been beating really fast, especially when I'm trying to sleep at night. I feel short of breath sometimes even when I'm just sitting down, and my palms get sweaty for no reason. I also have this constant feeling of worry in my chest and find it hard to concentrate at work. These symptoms seem to get worse when I'm stressed, but they're happening more frequently now.

I understand you're experiencing a rapid heartbeat, shortness of breath, sweaty palms, chest tightness, difficulty concentrating, and increased anxiety, especially at night and when stressed. These are concerning symptoms, and it's important to get them checked out by a doctor. 

It sounds like you're experiencing a combination of physical and emotional symptoms that could have several possible causes. Since I'm an AI and can't provide a diagnosis, it's crucial that you schedule an appointment with your physician or a healthcare professional as soon as possible. They can properly assess your symptoms, perform any necessary tests, and determine the underlying cause. 

In the meantime, try to practice some relaxation techniques like deep breathing exercises or meditation to help manage your anxiety. Getting enough sleep and avoiding caffeine and alcohol can also be helpful. However, remember that these are just temporary coping mechanisms, and a proper medical evaluation is essential for accurate diagnosis and treatment. Please don't hesitate to seek help â€“ your health is important.
